entries.meaning: The flow of water and sediment over the crest of a beach that does not directly return to the water body.

verbs.description: overwash (third-person singular simple present overwashes, present participle overwashing, simple past and past participle overwashed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To wash too much or too often.

examples: A man on one of the beach islands sends his wife and kids to the shelter, remains behind with their dog to finish boarding up the house, then the only road off the island overwashes, and he's cut off.
